overview: The document analyzes AI policy development in Africa, arguing that existing global readiness assessments do not fully capture the progress and unique realities of African states. It uses case studies to identify nuances missed by these assessments and offers policy considerations for improving AI readiness.
challenges: Weak or insufficient data protection regimes (Mauritius)
Complications in achieving robust oversight frameworks to support sustained sector growth (Kenya, Egypt)
Limited governance and economic resources to devote to technological and workforce development (Angola)
solutions: Public Engagement and Development of Human Capital
Harnessing local AI talent by recruiting experts for taskforces to guide governmental efforts on AI regulation (Angola)
Investments in electrical and data infrastructure are vital to enhance research capabilities (Angola)
Strategic investments in building AI institutes to facilitate the scaling of local AI research (Angola)

Integrating STEM training into primary and secondary school curricula and investing in post-secondary training and upskilling initiatives are crucial steps to nurture the human capital necessary to sustain Angola’s emerging AI industry (Angola)
metrics: Government promotion of investment in emerging technologies
Value of trade in ICT services (per capita)
Value of trade in ICT goods (per capita)
Time spent dealing with government regulations
Quality of engineering and technology higher education
Cost of internet-enabled device relative to GDP per capita
required_capabilities: Improve the quality of their public data
Provide clear guidelines for data access meant for private and public usage
Collaboration with civil society groups, universities, or public research centers for data collection
Sharing best practices on a bilateral or regional basis
Implementation of clear opportunities for public input from all sectors of society
Incorporate workforce development and technical skill-building provisions within their respective AI and data governance strategies
